summary: The Ivy League is a group of eight top private universities in the northeast of the USA. These schools are known for being very academic and hard to get into. They include Brown, Columbia, Cornell, Dartmouth, Harvard, Pennsylvania, Princeton, and Yale. The name "Ivy League" was first used in 1933 for sports teams and became official in 1954. Most of these universities were started during the colonial times.
title: Ivy League
